sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
Consider the below figure. It is given that GHI and IKL are two triangles where HG is parallel to IK . Also, \(GL : GI = 7 : 10 \). Now, 
itemize{}
\item Prove that \(\Delta GJL \sim \Delta IKL \)
\item Find GJ if \(IK = 9 \)
\item If JL is parallel to HI , find ratio of areas of triangles GJL and GHI .
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
Considering triangles GJL and IKL , we have
\[
	\angle GLJ = \angle ILK
\]
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle KIL 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\Delta GJL \sim \Delta IKL 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that
\[
	\frac{GL }{GI } = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{10 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 10 GL = 7 (GL + LI )
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow 3 GL = 7 LI 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{GL }{LI } = \frac{\input[s3v2]{} }{\input[s3v3]{} }
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{
As we already proved that $\Delta GJL \sim \Delta IKL $,}$$ 
\[
	\frac{GJ }{IK } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} }{LI }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{GJ }{9 } = \frac{7 }{3 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow GJ = \input[s4v3]{}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
It is given that JL is parallel to HI , so
\[
	\angle \input[s5v1]{}\input[s5v2]{}\input[s5v3]{} = \angle GHI 
\]
In triangles GJL and GHI , we got 
\[
	\angle G = \angle G 
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta GJL \sim \Delta GHI 
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta GJL }{\textrm{area of } \Delta GHI } = \frac{GL ^2}{GI ^2}
\]
\[
	= \frac{\input[s7v1]{} }{\input[s7v2]{} }
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["J", "G", "L"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle GLJ = \angle ILK${Vertically opposite angles}, and $\angle JGL = \angle KIL ${alternate interior angles}.}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [7, 7, 3], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification of $\frac{GL }{GI } = \frac{7 }{10 }$, we get $\frac{GL }{LI } \frac{7 }{3 }$}$$"}, {"data": ["G", "L", 21.0], "text": "$$\text{Since, $\Delta GJL \sim \Delta IKL $, therefore, $\frac{GJ }{IK } = \frac{GL }{LI }$, and hence, $GJ = 21.0 $.}$$"}, {"data": ["G", "J", "L"], "text": "$$\text{$\angle GJL = \angle GHI$,{corresponding angles are equal}.}$$ "}, {"data": [], "text": " "}, {"data": [49, 100], "text": "$$\text{$\frac{\textrm{area of }\Delta GJL }{\textrm{area of } \Delta GHI } = \frac{GL ^2}{GI ^2}= \frac{49 }{100 }$, as the ratio of the area of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of the corresponding sides.}$$ "}]
